name: Mexican Roasted Street Corn on the Cob
author: Michael B
summary: Hot, golden street corn that is both sweet and smoky with a bit of Mexican zip and zest.
ingredients: ½ cup crumbled Cotija cheese (queso anejado)
directions: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate
Mix together chili powder, kosher salt, and cayenne in a small bowl
Remove most of the silk while leaving 2 to 3 layers of husk on each ear of corn
Cook corn on the preheated grill until husks are slightly charred, turning every 3 to 4 minutes, for 12 to 14 minutes
Remove husks carefully, leaving stems on as handles
Squeeze 1/2 lime over each ear of corn
Sprinkle each with mixed seasonings to taste and top generously with Cotija cheese
